Confession:
 Some of my biggest (paying) clients who connected with me on LinkedInâ€¦
 I used automation to help me.

Butâ€¦
Automation wasnâ€™t the key to converting them from not-so-cold, to lukewarm, to warm, to hot.

What actually moved the needle?

 ğŸ‘‰ The heart to care.
 ğŸ‘‰ A service-first mindset.
 ğŸ‘‰ And showing absolute expertise..consistently.

Thatâ€™s why I donâ€™t get how some people oversell their automation tools.
Itâ€™s maybe 10% of the equation.

 The rest?
 You still have to show up.

 Think. Serve. Build trust. Solve problems.

Am I saying Iâ€™m great at it?

 Nope. Still learning. Because things shift fast.

What worked a few months ago?
 Stopped working.

 I had to think on my feet and evolve- again.

No updates in 4 years.
No replies to issues.
Most people wouldâ€™ve let it die.
I didnâ€™t.

A few months ago, I stumbled upon a GitHub repo that promised something incredible:
âœ… Scrape employees from your dream companies
âœ… Analyze their job history
âœ… Auto-send tailored connection requests with resumes

But LinkedIn had evolved. The code? Outdated and non-functional.
I had no idea where to startâ€”but I knew I didnâ€™t want this idea to go to waste.

So I rolled up my sleeves, forked the repo, and started learning.
Iâ€™m proud to share what Iâ€™ve built so far:

ğŸš€ ğ‹ğ¢ğ§ğ¤ğğğˆğ§ ğ‚ğ¨ğ§ğ§ğğœğ­ğ¢ğ¨ğ§ ğğ¨ğ­
 An automation tool that helps you connect with professionals (especially HRs) from your dream companiesâ€”with custom messages.

ğ‡ğğ«ğâ€™ğ¬ ğ°ğ¡ğšğ­ ğ¢ğ­ ğœğ®ğ«ğ«ğğ§ğ­ğ¥ğ² ğğ¨ğğ¬:
â€¢ Prioritizes HR profiles from target companies
â€¢ Sends custom messages based on role
â€¢ Plans smart outreach even around LinkedInâ€™s connection note limit (approx. 5/month for standard accounts)

âœ¨ Iâ€™m also working on a feature that stores pending messages and sends them after your request is accepted.

This was my first automation project. I made tons of mistakes. But I learned even more.

Huge thanks to Avish Mehta for the foundation, and to Mohit Kumar Singh for helping me figure out the messy parts and pushing me forward ğŸ™Œ

How to Automate Your Facebook and LinkedIn Outreach

I was using LinkedIn automation tool. 

NOT FOR COMMENTING.
Only sending requests and messages.

I got a warning 3 months ago from LinkedIn and since then I disabled it. 

But to be honest, the biggest problem is analytics.
I don't like LinkedIn analytics. 
And for sales navigator account, don't even ask. It's pathetic. 

External tools provided me a much better insight. 
Even as a marketer handling multiple client accounts, it was easy to create reports. 

Let me know if you have better alternatives that you have tried for analytics.

Also, feel free to tag product managers at LinkedIn :P

ğŸš¨ My LinkedIn Account Was Hacked â€” Please Read! ğŸš¨

Recently, my LinkedIn account was compromised and used to create fake hiring pages for fraudulent recruitment activities. Despite having 2-step verification enabled, the attacker managed to gain access â€” a clear reminder that even strong security can be bypassed in some cases.
As a result, my account was suspended due to a high volume of automation activity, which violated LinkedInâ€™s guidelines. The recovery process involved complex government ID verification and several frustrating steps.

ğŸ”’ Key Takeaways for Everyone:
- Regularly review your LinkedIn login history and connected apps.
- Stay away from clicking any links in LinkedIn which looks unsecure [Eg: Apply for this job by the below link]
- Avoid using the same passwords across platforms.
- Be cautious with browser extensions or apps linked to your LinkedIn.
- Consider using an authenticator app instead of SMS for 2FA.
- Keep a backup of your LinkedIn data â€” just in case.

Iâ€™m back now â€” but this experience was a real eye-opener.

If you received any suspicious messages from me recently, I sincerely apologize. Stay safe out there â€” the threat is real, even in professional networks.

Missing LinkedIn Services for QA & Test Automation Professionals!

While LinkedIn has made it easier for professionals to showcase their offerings through the â€œOpen for Businessâ€ feature, there's still a major gap for those of us in the Software Testing, QA, and Automation domain. 

Despite the critical role QA plays in product success, many relevant service categories are still missing from LinkedInâ€™s official service listings. Here are a few that should be added:

1. Manual Testing
2. Quality Assurance
3. Test Automation
4. QA Consulting
5. Software Testing & QA Mentorship
6. Functional Testing
7. Regression Testing (Manual)
8. Regression Testing (Automated)
9. UAT Support
10. Salesforce Testing
11. Salesforce Test Automation
12. Testing Framework Design

If you're a QA professional, consultant, freelancer, or mentorâ€”you probably found yourself trying to fit your services under generic tags like IT Consulting or Software Development.

Itâ€™s time for LinkedIn to recognize the specialized skill sets and value that QA professionals bring to the tech ecosystem.

Please like, comment, or share if you agreeâ€”letâ€™s help bring visibility to these essential services and make space for every quality advocate out there!
